sentences: Me peame kiirustama, et jõuaksime ajale.
context: The word 'kiirustage' is the plural command form (imperative) of the verb 'kiirustama', which means 'to hurry' or 'to rush'. It's used when addressing multiple people to tell them to hurry up. The root word 'kiirus' means 'speed' in Estonian, so this literally relates to increasing speed.
